short_description: Train a Neural Network for input data
long_description: Train a Neural Network using back propagation and output Network weight table

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the input data to be trained.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the input data to be trained.

input_tables.name: WeightTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the table that lists the starting values for the neural network weights. The Weights Table is discussed in further detail.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table that lists the starting values for the neural network weights. The Weights Table is discussed in further detail.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.description: Specifies the table to output the trained network weight data to.
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table to output the trained network weight data to.

argument_clauses.name: InputColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the columns of the data that contains the numerical predictor variables x1, x2, x3, etc.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the columns of the InputTable that contains the numerical predictor variables x1, x2, x3, etc.

argument_clauses.name: ResponseColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the columns of data that contains the numerical dependent variables y1, y2, y3, etc.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the columns of InputTable that contains the numerical dependent variables y1, y2, y3, etc.

argument_clauses.name: GroupByColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the columns that are used to output different neural networks for different groups. These columns should be included in the Weights Table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the columns that are used to output different neural networks for different groups. These columns should be included in the Weights Table.

argument_clauses.name: HiddenLayers
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of hidden neurons in each layer, from left to right, by list of integers. Default value is 1 layer, 1 neuron. For example, hidden.layers('5','5') would produce a 3-layer network with 5 neurons in each hidden layer, while hidden.layers('3') would produce the network
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of hidden neurons in each layer, from left to right, by list of integers. Default value is 1 layer, 1 neuron. For example, HiddenLayers('5','5') would produce a 3-layer network with 5 neurons in each hidden layer, while HiddenLayers('3') would produce the network

argument_clauses.name: Threshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the threshold for the partial derivatives of the error function as stopping criteria. Default value is 0.01.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the threshold for the partial derivatives of the error function as stopping criteria. Default value is 0.01.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of steps for the training of the neural network. Default value is 1.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of steps for the training of the neural network. Default value is 1.

argument_clauses.name: LearningRate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the learning rate used by traditional backpropagation. Default value is 0.001.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the learning rate used by traditional backpropagation. Default value is 0.001.

argument_clauses.name: ActivationFunction
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the differentiable function that is applied to the result of the cross-product of the neurons and the weights. Available choices are ‘logistic’ (default) and hyperbolic tangent (‘tanh’).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the differentiable function that is applied to the result of the cross-product of the neurons and the weights. Available choices are ‘logistic’ (default) and hyperbolic tangent (‘tanh’).

argument_clauses.name: ErrorFunction
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the differentiable function that is used for the calculation of the error. Available choices are ‘sse’ (sum of squared errors, the default) and cross-entropy (‘ce’).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the differentiable function that is used for the calculation of the error. Available choices are ‘sse’ (sum of squared errors, the default) and cross-entropy (‘ce’).

argument_clauses.name: Algorithms
argument_clauses.rDescription: This string contains the algorithm type that is used to calculate the neural network. Currently, only ‘backprop’ is supported.
argument_clauses.description: This string contains the algorithm type that is used to calculate the neural network. Currently, only ‘backprop’ is supported.

argument_clauses.name: LinearOutput
argument_clauses.rDescription: This logical value defines whether the ActivationFunction should (FALSE) or should not (TRUE) be applied to the output neurons.
argument_clauses.description: This logical value defines whether the ActivationFunction should (FALSE) or should not (TRUE) be applied to the output neurons.

argument_clauses.name: Seed
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the random seed used to initialize the algorithm.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the random seed used to initialize the algorithm.
